answers.answer: At the very least, call your doctor/midwife/the hospital you plan to deliver at. Explain your symptoms and ask for a professional opinion. That way you're not "going in for nothing" but you're also not making any possible problem worse.
Those are symptoms of preclmasia it can kill you if you dont treat it go get checked most people dont believe anything is wrong and it is

When is her next doctor's appointment?  I was never one to rush to the er (and had pregnancy hypertension and saw spots and had headaches too) but I did see the doctor in the office when I had a concern.  She could always go check her blood pressure at Kroger or Walgreens (or wherever) and if it is really high, that might motivate her to call her doctor for advice.Anyway, keep in mind if you cause her stress by getting upset with her for not going to the hospital, that won't help her blood pressure.  :>)Just encourage her to either check her blood pressure herself or be seen this week by her regular doctor.  good luck

Ive been telling her. I have it. And.shes just following in the sane footsteps i did. Shes just being stubborn. Id rather her go.be checked.. and nothing be wrong.. then i knew what was wrong.. and didnt do anything.
Its in a week and a day. Her doctor is stupid and charges 25$ for a call..

The doctor charges for a phone call?  That is ridiculous and really, probably not ethical.   In fact, I'd call your state medical board as how would they bill insurance for that?  Could even be illegal.  No joke.  Are you sure you aren't talking about the patient copay when she SEEs the doctor?My insurance company has a call in line for patients as well.  I mean, it's a waste of money to go to the ER for something like that when a phone call would suffix to then make a plan of action.  That's my opinion any way.Okay, sorry.  A bit of an off topic there.  but, calling her doctor is a lot cheaper than a copay at the hospital and she then could be seen in the next couple of days.  And double check on the doctor getting paid for phone calls.  I've never heard of anything like that and again, would imagine that is not condoned by the medical board in your state.  good luck
Call the hospital and ask for the labor and delivery. The nurse there can help!

question: So i have a pregnant friend. She is 33+6, lost some of her mucous plug, and has had some contractions.Shes showing signs of preeclampsia, or even toximia the way she swells up. Gets nausous all the time. Sees dots. And has never ending headaches.She is having problems, and doesnt believe she should go in.. 'what if its nothing'If your doubting the health of the baby.. go. Anyone else care to comment and tell her to go. Please&thankyou.
title: stubborn friend wont go in.. opinions..
